turns.content: can you advise me a extremely lightweight Linux distribution, for a a script that run once the day

Yes, there are several lightweight Linux distributions that you could use for running a script once a day. Here are a few options:

1. Tiny Core Linux: This is an extremely lightweight Linux distribution that can run entirely from RAM, making it very fast and suitable for running scripts. It has a minimalistic interface and requires very little disk space.
2. Puppy Linux: Puppy Linux is another lightweight Linux distribution that is designed to be very easy to use. It can run entirely from RAM or be installed to a hard drive. It also has a very small footprint and can be customized to suit your needs.
3. Damn Small Linux: As the name suggests, Damn Small Linux is a very small Linux distribution that can run on older hardware. It has a minimalistic interface and comes with a few basic applications pre-installed. It can also be installed to a hard drive if needed.
4. Lubuntu: Lubuntu is a lightweight version of Ubuntu, one of the most popular Linux distributions. It is designed to be fast and efficient and can run on older hardware. It comes with a minimalistic interface and includes the basic applications you need to get started.

Ultimately, the best distribution for you will depend on your specific needs and preferences. If you want an extremely lightweight distribution with a small footprint, then Tiny Core Linux or Damn Small Linux may be the best option. If you prefer a more user-friendly interface, then Lubuntu or Puppy Linux may be a better choice.
